title: Tina O'Brien's daughter plotting career as West End musical star
text:

Tina O'Brien played Coronation Street favourite Sarah Platt for 20 years, and she's now beaming at the fact her daughter Scarlett is set to start her own career on stage.

But instead of following her famous mum and appearing on Corrie, 10-year-old Scarlett is keen to become a singer and work in musical theatre.

Scarlett attends the Drama MOB, a drama school and casting agency launched by her mum Tina and best friend Esther Morgan in 2013.

The pair set up the school as Tina couldn't find anywhere suitable for Scarlett in the area.

(Image: Sean Hansford)

Tina told Manchester Evening News : "From the age of three she started singing so she started singing before she showed any interest in acting.

"She used to say 'I don't really fancy the acting but I like the singing' and she used to sing Castle On A Cloud from Les Mis.

"A teacher sent me a video of her singing it and I thought 'oh my gosh she's actually really quite good.'"

(Image: Sean Hansford)

Tina's character has been through a hard time on the cobbles of Weatherfield, particularly the live episode of 2015 when her character was attacked by Callum Logan.

She admitted her daughter doesn't watch her on the ITV soap, "Only because it's her bedtime."

(Image: Sean Hansford)

She went on: "I've occasionally let her watch it but I have to be careful with what she watches because she accidentally watched the live show.

"I was at an awards do and they showed a clip of a live episode that I'd done where this guy was throwing me around the room and she did not like it at all."

(Image: Sean Hansford)

Tina revealed that she thinks her daughter wants to be a singer and to go to a musical theatre school.

She added: "I keep saying 'if you try really, really hard at school when you get older you can do' so she'll write things in my diary like, 'don't forget when I get older, performing arts school.'"
description: Tina O'Brien and Ryan Thomas' daughter Scarlett dreams of a career on stage, following in her mum's footsteps
